action: I want to update employee permissions according to their role changes
reason: To prevent unauthorized access and control business operations
acceptance_criteria: Permission changes only possible by the Administrator role.
Target User ID is mandatory.
Fails if a non-existent User ID is specified.
Roles can only be selected from a predefined list.
Permission change history must be maintained.
Record roles before and after the change in the history.
JWT reflects the new role at the next login.
SQL injection countermeasures must be implemented.
Input value sanitization must be performed.
Permission change operation logs must be stored.
Logs include admin_user_id, target_user_id, and timestamp.
HTTPS communication is mandatory.
Rate limiting is applied to the endpoint.
API must be REST-compliant.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Permission changes must be rolled back if they fail.
Target response time for API is within 300ms.
Invalid requests return 403 Forbidden.
Verification must be performed on the backend, not just the frontend.
Permission cache is updated immediately upon change.
